comment.text: Housekeeping enzyme that catalyzes the last step in proline biosynthesis. Can utilize both NAD and NADP, but has higher affinity for NAD. Involved in the cellular response to oxidative stress.
Subject to competitive inhibition by the reaction product proline. Subject to competitive inhibition by stearoyl coenzyme A.
Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-proline biosynthesis; L-proline from L-glutamate 5-semialdehyde: step 1/1.
Homodecamer; composed of 5 homodimers (PubMed:16730026, Ref.18). Interacts with LTO1 (PubMed:24930674).

disease.name: Cutis laxa, autosomal recessive, 2B
disease.description: A disorder characterized by an excessive congenital skin wrinkling, a large fontanelle with delayed closure, a typical facial appearance with downslanting palpebral fissures, a general connective tissue weakness, and varying degrees of growth and developmental delay and neurological abnormalities. Patients do not manifest metabolic abnormalities.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

disease.name: Cutis laxa, autosomal recessive, 3B
disease.description: A disorder characterized by an aged appearance with distinctive facial features, sparse hair, ophthalmologic abnormalities, intrauterine growth retardation, and cutis laxa.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
Belongs to the pyrroline-5-carboxylate reductase family.

property.value: Expressed in pancreas and 201 other tissues
P:negative regulation of hydrogen peroxide-induced cell death

feature.description: In ARCL3B; results in a reduction of protein expression in skin fibroblasts from the patient; dbSNP:rs281875319.
In ARCL2B; may cause skipping of exon 6; dbSNP:rs121918374.
